intro: Illigera appendiculata subsp. appendiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved illigera, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically thrives in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom during the warmer months and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
